1578007868_16dnrZKRMLhQCjv6nxx7tP5KJ2H2P.body:
Or you could do the simple rational thing of going over to your neighbors house, and saying "Howdy neighbor!  I see you got yourself some cool new surveillance equipment.  Has there been some activity in our neighborhood that prompted you to install that new equipment, or that I should be concerned about?  I also see that one of your cameras is overlooking my backyard.  Do you think you could make sure that it only captures your yard, as I too value my privacy and security.  Thanks neighbor!"

If asking nicely doesn't work then just call the cops, and tell them your neighbor has a camera pointed at your house, and you believe he's being a Peeping Tom, watching you or your girlfriend / boyfriend nude sunbathing.  Then when they show up, stand at the edge of your backyard line.  Depending on where you live an altercation will most likely break out when your neighbor comes out to confront you, and the police will most likely shoot him, and it will all be caught on tape by his surveillance camera.  Then when you watch the evening news you'll be able to see whether the camera was recording your yard or not.

> [draugrdeathlord](#comment_213_12BRJSQrTETJVZzt2jHdqPywv3SdugSywC): Apathy

This.  Our apathy is their victory.  We've allowed them to create draconian laws that will pretty much ruin your life if you break one of them.  Most of the time you don't even know what those laws are because they make them up as they go.  Jane Fonda gets arrested every Friday for the same thing.  Do you care?  Do you do anything to support her?  NO.  Because we're all too afraid to lose the little bit that we think we have.  Ed Snowden is also just one person who tried to wake us up to what's going on.  Until ever last one of us is willing to put everything on the line nothing will ever change.
